page.title: 07SICKLINGHALL VILLAGE HALL
page.content:
The idea of a village hall in Sicklinghall was first thought of by a Mr. Fryer in May 1945. It was not until 1952 that the hall was completed at a cost of Â£3,500 (Â£1,500 of which was raised by the villagers through jumble-sales, Â£1,000 was donated by Mr. G.R.Foster and Â£1,000 was received from the Ministry of Education). It was officially opened in 1953.
The hall is managed by a committee of local people and provides a wide range of activities, including whist drives, darts, dominoes, snooker and dancing. It is hoped to extend the range of activities to include a youth club, drama group and adult evening classes. The village hall is an important feature of the village as it represents a focal point where young and old can meet.
